Articles.Content:
It would be interesting to see a mod where players can code in sequences of action groups. Say they want a sequence where an engine is turned on and off at a certain interval, or the player wants to many things to decouple in line but doesn't want to keep hitting the action group buttons.

I don't know how to code or how the game code works so if something like this isn't possible, please excuse my ignorance.

You want something like automatically repeated action group activations. I can't think of an actual use case for such a thing. Is there one? Your examples can't convince me.

You might be able to use two [Smart Parts](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/64227) Timers which activate each other to repeate the same actions over and over but I'm not sure if that really works. Try it. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-09T01:37:10Z" title="06/09/2015 01:37  AM" data-short="9 yr">June 9, 2015</time> by \*Aqua\***

Smart Parts is probably the simplest thing, but at some level if you're saying "do this then that", you're coding, whether you call it that or not ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) Rearranging the staging sequence is a primitive form of coding.

Also check out:

[Auto Actions](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/101994) (fire action groups at start)

[kOS](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/68089) (full automation)
